meanings.definition: Prudent or thrifty in managing one's resources
meanings.sent1: She was very forehanded with her money, always saving for a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: Being forehanded with your expenses can help you avoid financial stress.
meanings.sent3: The forehanded squirrel saved nuts for winter and had a cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: His forehanded approach to budgeting was like having a safety net for unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent5: The forehanded farmer stored extra grain in case of a poor harvest.

meanings.sent1: She packed her bags forehanded before the trip to avoid last-minute rush.
meanings.sent2: Arriving forehanded at the airport allowed them to relax before the flight.
meanings.sent3: He double-checked his work forehanded to ensure everything was perfect.
meanings.sent4: The team prepared forehanded for the presentation, impressing their clients.
meanings.sent5: Forehanded planning helped them complete the project ahead of schedule.

meanings.sent1: The forehanded decision to invest early paid off in the long run.
meanings.sent2: Forehanded individuals tend to be more successful in achieving their goals.
meanings.sent3: Her forehanded choice to study in advance made the exam stress-free.
meanings.sent4: The forehanded strategy of setting milestones kept the project on track.
meanings.sent5: Forehanded thinkers anticipate challenges and prepare solutions in advance.
